item.title: BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report

Date: 11 January 2025Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has reversed its decision regarding KL Rahul's participation in the upcoming ODI series against England. Initially resting him, the board has now requested his availability as they aim to provide him with match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy in February.

  • BCCI had initially agreed to KL Rahul's break from the ODI assignment.
  • Recent developments show the board now wants him available for selection.
  • Rahul's performance in the Test series in Australia was notable, being the third-highest run-getter for India.
  • Competition for the wicketkeeper batter's slot includes Rishabh Pant and Sanju Samson.
  • The board is seeking an extension from the ICC for the Champions Trophy squad announcement.
“The selectors initially decided to rest Rahul… However, they had a rethink and the BCCI has now asked him to play…”

This change signifies the BCCI's emphasis on Rahul's performance potential and readiness for future tournaments, demonstrating a dynamic approach to player management.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What ball-tracking and control data tell us - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What ball-tracking and control data tell us

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, India's bowling strategy against Australia proved effective, highlighting significant differences in their approaches to good lengths and seam movement.

  • India successfully bowled in the 6-8 metre good length range, frequently hitting the stumps.
  • Australia struggled with their traditional 5-7 metre lengths, conceding runs and struggling to connect.
  • Seam movement remained a key factor, with Jasprit Bumrah achieving notable deviation.
  • Defensive batting akin to Cheteshwar Pujara's style proved effective for Australia.
  • India's reliance on Bumrah highlighted vulnerabilities in their other bowlers.
  • Australia effectively used bouncers, with significant success compared to India's bowling tactics.
  • Both sides faced challenges with false shots, yet Australia managed to capitalize better during critical moments.
“India were actually a little unlucky... but, then again, India were really lucky in Brisbane with the rain.”

In conclusion, the series showcased crucial insights into the impact of bowling lengths and seam movement, offering lessons for future match strategies.

item.title: 'Chat GPT product': Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana called out for supporting Gautam Gambhir with similar statements - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Harshit and Nitish Rana Called Out for Supporting Gautam Gambhir

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana have come under scrutiny for their identical statements on social media in support of Gautam Gambhir, following comments made by Manoj Tiwary that criticized Gambhir’s coaching methods.

  • Manoj Tiwary labeled Gambhir a "hypocrite" for supporting foreign coaches despite previously criticizing their appointment.
  • Aakash Chopra pointed out the similarities in Rana's statements, suggesting they feel like a "Chat GPT product".
  • Gambhir's coaching received backlash after India’s recent losses, including the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
Aakash Chopra stated, "There are many similarities in both statements, or someone wrote them and sent them to post on social media. It felt like both statements were written by the same man or machine. It could be Chat GPT, for all we know."

The controversy highlights concerns regarding Gambhir's coaching effectiveness and the authenticity of public support from players.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 30, SIX vs SCO Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between SIX vs SCO? - CricTracker

item.title: New Twist To Champions Trophy Squad Saga, BCCI Seeks Extension. Mohammed Shami To... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
New Twist To Champions Trophy Squad Saga, BCCI Seeks Extension

Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

As the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) nears the Champions Trophy squad selection deadline, a big boost has reportedly come in the form of veteran pacer Mohammed Shami. Though Shami couldn't prove his fitness for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, it has been reported that he is all set to be picked for India's ODI squad against England, as well as the Champions Trophy, if his comeback goes as planned.

  • Shami has received clearance for a return to the national team, following ankle injuries.
  • The BCCI has sought an extension from the ICC over the announcement of the India squad for the Champions Trophy.
  • The T20I squad for the England series is expected to be announced soon.
  • England and India will play five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22, 2025.
"Though ICC allows teams to make changes one month after the provisional squad is announced, it seems like the BCCI requires more time to finalize the roster for the tournament in Pakistan and UAE."

In conclusion, the BCCI's request for an extension highlights the complexities of finalizing player rosters amidst injuries and the need for strategic preparation for upcoming tournaments.

item.title: Monfils tops Bergs, makes history in Auckland - ATP Tour
item.description:
Gael Monfils tops Zizou Bergs, makes history in Auckland

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: ATP Tour

Gael Monfils made history by becoming the oldest man to win a tour-level title, defeating Zizou Bergs at the ASB Classic in Auckland.

  • Monfils won the match 6-3, 6-4, claiming his 13th tour-level title.
  • This victory is his first title since the 2023 BNP Paribas Nordic Open.
  • Monfils, age 38, surpassed the previous record held by Ken Rosewall.
  • Bergs reached a career-high ranking of No. 60 following this tournament.
  • The match lasted for one hour and 37 minutes.
“Age is a number. But we keep working. I keep believing that I can play high-quality tennis and I have been showing it this week so I am very happy.” – Gael Monfils

Monfils will compete in the upcoming Australian Open, beginning with a match against Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard.

item.title: Yuzvendra Chahal lands at ‘Bigg Boss 18’ set with Shreyas Iyer amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yuzvendra Chahal Spotted at 'Bigg Boss 18' Amid Divorce Rumors

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal made headlines as he was seen at the 'Bigg Boss 18' sets amidst ongoing divorce rumors with his wife, Dhanashree Verma. Accompanied by fellow cricketers Shreyas Iyer and Shashank Singh, Chahal's appearance has sparked media interest.

  • Chahal was spotted in casual attire, including a stylish black T-shirt and blue denim jeans.
  • The three cricketers are expected to appear in an upcoming episode of 'Bigg Boss 18' hosted by Salman Khan.
  • Chahal made a public statement urging fans not to speculate on his personal life due to emotional distress caused by the rumors.
  • Dhanashree Verma expressed her frustrations regarding the negative comments on social media, labeling them as baseless.
“I understand the curiosity surrounding recent events... However, I humbly request everyone not to indulge in speculation as it has caused immense pain to me and my family.” - Yuzvendra Chahal

The incident highlights the challenges faced by public figures regarding personal matters, attracting significant media scrutiny.

item.title: Afghan women just wanna ‘Bend it like Bumrah’ but the world failed them - The Indian Express
item.description:
Afghan women just wanna ‘Bend it like Bumrah’ but the world failed them

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The article reflects on the aspirations of Afghan women cricketers alongside their struggles amid strict regulations imposed by the Taliban, drawing parallels with cultural barriers depicted in the film Bend It Like Beckham.

  • Afghan women's cricket team set to play an exhibition match in Melbourne.
  • The film Bend It Like Beckham is referenced as a metaphor for breaking gender barriers.
  • The struggles of Afghan women highlight global indifference to their plight.
  • Key cultural expectations and restrictions on women are emphasized.
“Mum, it’s Beckham’s corner!” - A quote illustrating the significance of sports to women’s empowerment.

The aspirations of Afghan women for participation in sports showcase their resilience and aspiration for a brighter future, despite existing challenges.

item.title: Happy Birthday Rahul Dravid! - Rediff.com
item.description:
Happy Birthday Rahul Dravid!

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Rediff.com

Cricket legend Rahul Dravid, known as 'The Wall', celebrates his 52nd birthday today. Rediff.com commemorates the contributions of this cricketing icon.

  • Dravid is famous for his unmatched technique and humility.
  • He made his Test debut against England at Lords in 1996, scoring 95 runs in his first innings.
  • In ODIs, he debuted against Sri Lanka in 1996 and has a highest score of 153 against New Zealand.
  • Dravid played just one T20I, scoring 31 runs against England in 2011.
  • In the IPL, he played for RCB and RR, with a highest score of 75*.
"Known for his unmatched technique, unwavering patience, and humility, Dravid's contribution to cricket transcends mere statistics." - Rupak De Chowdhuri/Reuters

Rahul Dravid's legacy in cricket continues to inspire many, celebrating not just records but the spirit of the game.

item.title: ‘He doesn't get edge, doesn't get LBW, hasn't got out': Ashwin ready to 'change name' if Pant's defence is questioned - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ashwin Defends Pant's Technique Amid Criticism

Publication Date: N/A Source: Hindustan Times

Ravichandran Ashwin has come to the defense of Rishabh Pant, stating he has the potential to excel in Test cricket by finding a balance between his aggressive and defensive techniques.

  • Pant has faced criticism for poor shot selection in recent matches.
  • Ashwin insists Pant's defense is strong and rarely gets him out.
  • He highlights the need for Pant to find a middle ground in his gameplay.
  • Pant's performance in two recent innings showed contrasting styles.
Ashwin stated, "I will change my name if someone can show me Pant getting out while defending 10 times."

The key takeaway is that with proper guidance, Pant can leverage his skills to improve his consistency on the field.

item.title: "Doesn't Edge, Doesn't Get LBW, Has Best Defence": R Ashwin On India Star Rishabh Pant - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Doesn't Edge, Doesn't Get LBW, Has Best Defence: R Ashwin On India Star Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: N/A Source: NDTV

Indian spin legend R Ashwin believes that Rishabh Pant has the capability to score a century in every game if he can temper his aggressive style and leverage his strong defensive skills.

  • R Ashwin praises Rishabh Pant's defensive technique, stating it is among the best in world cricket.
  • Pant showed contrasting performances in a recent Test, scoring 40 runs in one innings and 61 runs in another.
  • Ashwin emphasizes the importance of finding balance in Pant's aggressive and defensive playing styles to maximize his potential.
  • He notes that Pant does not often get out playing defensively, reinforcing his belief in Pant's ability.
“Rishabh Pant has played in these times... He has one of the best defences in world cricket.” - R Ashwin

Ashwin concludes by expressing his ongoing passion for cricket following his retirement from international play and his desire to share his experiences as a cricketer.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy squad announcement postponed, BCCI requests ICC for extension, new date is…: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI Postpones India's Champions Trophy Squad Announcement

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The BCCI has requested an extension from the ICC for announcing India's squad for the Champions Trophy, which was initially scheduled for January 12, in order to finalize their selection.

  • The announcement delay stems from the BCCI's request for more time to finalize the squad.
  • Teams were expected to name provisional squads five weeks before the tournament, but the BCCI is citing recent commitments in Australia.
  • The new date for announcing the squad is likely January 19, one month before the tournament starts.
  • The provisional squad is expected to see mostly the same players as those in the ODI series against England.
  • India's T20I squad against England is also expected to be announced shortly.
  • A review meeting will involve BCCI officials, captain Rohit Sharma, and coach Gautam Gambhir.
The BCCI aims to finalize the squad while addressing recent performance issues after a disappointing series against Australia.

The BCCI's careful planning aims to ensure that the squad is well-prepared following recent overseas matches, indicating a strategic approach to the upcoming Champions Trophy.

item.title: 'Let's be honest. South Africa not favourites for WTC final': Pollock doubts Bavuma's Proteas but ready for a surprise - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Let's be honest. South Africa not favourites for WTC final: Pollock doubts Bavuma's Proteas but ready for a surprise

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former captain Shaun Pollock expresses doubts about South Africa's chances in the WTC final against Australia, although he acknowledges unexpected outcomes in cricket are possible.

  • South Africa has won their last seven Tests but are deemed not favourites for the final.
  • Pollock highlights South Africa's historical struggles in knockout matches.
  • Despite their recent form, Australia comes off a strong 3-1 series win against India.
  • Pollock admires the resilience of the South African team under captain Temba Bavuma.
"I don't think we are going in as favourites. Let's be honest." - Shaun Pollock

The matchup is set to take place at Lord's Cricket Ground starting June 11, raising anticipation for a challenging contest.

item.title: Ex-Indian cricketer left his country to chase girlfriend, faced ban in South Africa but still rose to become millionaire - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ex-Indian cricketer left his country to chase girlfriend, faced ban in South Africa but still rose to become millionaire

Date: January 10, 2025   Source: Hindustan Times

This article tells the inspiring story of Mahalingam Venkatesan, an Indian cricketer whose pursuit of love led him to South Africa, despite facing numerous challenges including a ban from playing cricket there. With resilience and determination, he transformed his life and career, eventually becoming a successful entrepreneur.

  • Mali met his wife, a South African-Indian, in 1983 and pursued her to South Africa, risking his cricket career.
  • He played for local teams in South Africa but was eventually banned due to visa complications.
  • After returning to India, he faced a serious injury that hampered his cricketing career.
  • He later found success in the restaurant business in South Africa, building a substantial fortune.
  • Mali now enjoys a happy life with his wife and children, reminiscing about his cricketing past and his journey.
"I have no regrets today. I came here and started three restaurants. My net worth was about two million Rand." - Mahalingam Venkatesan

Mali's story is a testament to following one's heart, overcoming adversity, and the unexpected paths that can lead to success.

item.title: PSG, Napoli Set to Meet, Finalize Transfer for €75M-Rated Man Utd Target - PSG Talk
item.description:
PSG, Napoli Set to Meet, Finalize Transfer for €75M-Rated Man Utd Target

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: PSG Talk

Khvicha Kvaratskhelia, Napoli's 23-year-old winger, is attracting interest from Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) and Manchester United.

  • Kvaratskhelia is under contract until 2027 but hasn't agreed to an extension.
  • PSG and Napoli are set to meet to finalize Kvaratskhelia’s transfer, with a verbal agreement reported.
  • The Ligue 1 club is prepared to offer between €70 million and €75 million, with a potential loan deal for Milan Škriniar included.
  • Kvaratskhelia’s impressive performances have drawn attention from several Premier League clubs, including Manchester United and Liverpool.
  • PSG has a backup plan in case negotiations with Napoli fail.
🚨🥈| JUST IN: PSG and Napoli will meet next week to finalize Khvicha Kvaratskhelia’s move, with a verbal agreement reportedly in place.

This transfer could significantly shape the future of Kvaratskhelia and impact both Napoli and PSG in the coming seasons.

item.title: ‘Difficult situation’ – Ruben Amorim refuses to guarantee Man Utd will keep Kobbie Mainoo as Chelsea eye £6... - The Sun
item.description:
Ruben Amorim Uncertain on Kobbie Mainoo's Future Amid Chelsea Interest

Date: January 2025 | Source: The Sun

Ruben Amorim, the head coach of Manchester United, expressed uncertainty about the future of young midfielder Kobbie Mainoo amid significant interest from Chelsea. The 19-year-old, valued at £60 million, may have to be sold to keep United compliant with financial regulations.

  • Mainoo's current contract is set to expire in 2027, and he is seeking a pay rise from his £20,000-a-week deal.
  • Amorim emphasized the difficult position the club is in regarding player retention and financial sustainability.
  • Other academy prospects such as Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford could also be at risk of transfer to balance the books.
“Our idea is always to keep our best players but we also know that it is a difficult situation for the club, a hard moment.” - Ruben Amorim

In conclusion, the situation surrounding Kobbie Mainoo is complex, with financial implications affecting the decisions concerning player contracts and transfers at Manchester United.
